availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Leitchfield, Kentucky cabinetmaker. Kentucky native. Married Ann R. Edelen. Father of Austin Edelen, John W. Edelen, James Edelen, Margaret P. Edelen, Ann L. Edelen, and Mary E. Edelen. Held five slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Leitchfield, p. 4. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Leitchfield, p. 1. “Joseph C. Edelen (1814-1888),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 63192562, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=63192562&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
